Question
========

A politician is convinced that at least 50% of her constituents believe that a child has the right to live with either parent. But the latest poll of 500 voters in her district shows that slightly less than half, only 240 or 48%, support this position supports. If indeed 50% of these voters in her district share this opinion, what is the probability that of a random sample of 500 voters 240 or fewer hold this view?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,19
* 0,48
* 0,50
* 0,89

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.19: Correct
* 0.48: Incorrect
* 0.50: Incorrect
* 0.89: Incorrect
